content: sara basic fingerless mitts material and size yarn silk blend from manos del uruguay 50 g = 135 m 1 skein needles dpns size 3 5 mm or size needed to obtain 11 stitches x 16 row for 5 x 5 cm in stocking stitch size small medium large both mitts cast on 32 36 40 stitches and join for knitting in the round be careful not to twist knit rib *k1 p1* repeat *-* until work measures 10 cm knit stocking stitch all stitches are knitted until work measures 1 cm from the rib approx 4-5 row start knitting thumb increases as described below right hand thumb gusset k1 place marker yo k1 yo place marker k30 34 38 the 3 stitches between the markers are you first thumb gusset stitches the yarn overs are knitted in back loop on the next row to avoid holes the markers are slipped on every row keep making increases on every third row as described above until you have 13 13 15 stitches between the markers the yarn overs are always made next to the markers knit 2 more row after the last increase then place thumb stitches on a stitch holder or scrap yarn cast on 1 new stitch behind the thumb on the next row work should now measure approximately 16 17 18 cm left hand thumb gusset the left hand gusset is knitted as right hand gusset but the markers are placed around the 15th 17th 19th stitch instead of the 2nd on the first row of increases thus the first row is knitted as follows k14 16 18 place marker yo k1 yo place marker k17 19 21 after the thumb gusset is complete keep knitting as before thus knitting all stitches until work measures approx 20 21 22 cm about 1 5 cm left to the lower joint of your little finger when you try the mitt on knit rib k1 p1 for 5 row cast off in rib thumb all stitches on the thumb are knitted place the 13 13 15 stitches on the stitch holder back onto your needles and pick up 4 additional stitches behind the thumb the 4 new stitches are knitted k2tog on the next row making the total number of thumb stitches 15 15 17 keep knitting all stitches until thumb measures approximately 1 5-2 cm the thumb should reach just up to the joint of your thumb when the mitt is tried on cast off knitwise © johannagistvik designs
